forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. South southwest wind 9 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the afternoon unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a steady rain blankets the city, accentuating the charm of the urban landscape, albeit one cloaked in a muted palette of grays. The clouds hang heavily, dimming the vibrancy of the day and ushering in a cold wind from the south, which whips through the streets with gusts that remind one of the Bay’s capricious nature. Visibility is minimal, with fog creeping in from the water, swirling around the Golden Gate Bridge, merging with the raindrops to create a soft blur where the skyline meets the horizon.

Tonight will carry the same themes, with temperatures dipping but not too low, while the rain persists, wrapping the evening in a comforting patter against windows. Attire should embrace warmth and water-resistance; a sturdy umbrella and a waterproof jacket are wise companions for those venturing outdoors. The ambiance, though gray and wet, invites quiet introspection. A visit to a nearby café, nestled with the promise of coffee and conversation, might just be the perfect remedy for this rainy day, allowing one to savor the moment and appreciate the city’s rhythmic pulse, even when obscured by clouds and mist.
